meanings.definition: Lacking sharpness or keenness of edge or point.
meanings.sent1: The knife was the bluntest tool in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: She used the bluntest scissors to cut the paper.
meanings.sent3: He tried to cut the cake with the bluntest knife, but it just squished it instead.
meanings.sent4: Her bluntest pencil couldn't even draw a straight line.
meanings.sent5: The bluntest blade couldn't even slice through the soft bread.

meanings.definition: Abrupt in manner or speech often to the point of ungracious harshness.
meanings.sent1: His bluntest response left everyone in shock.
meanings.sent2: She gave the bluntest rejection without any explanation.
meanings.sent3: The bluntest way to ask for help is by shouting demands.
meanings.sent4: His bluntest words cut through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bluntest criticism made her rethink her actions.

meanings.definition: Characterized by directness in manner or speech; without subtlety or evasion.
meanings.sent1: Her bluntest advice was to just tell the truth.
meanings.sent2: He appreciated her bluntest honesty in the situation.
meanings.sent3: The bluntest way to handle the problem was to face it head-on.
meanings.sent4: His bluntest remark made everyone stop and listen.
meanings.sent5: The bluntest approach to the issue was to address it immediately.
